The Future of Dialoggs

A few weeks ago, Drew Wilson launched a sneak peak of the future of his social network, Dialoggs.

Dialoggs launched in late October as a great place to have lengthy conversations with others in public (or private). I've always thought of it as Twitter, but without the pesky character limit. In a recent interview, Drew announced that Dialoggs was headed in another direction, and the future of Dialoggs would be video.

You can view a demo now by pulling up http://call.dialog.gs in Chrome. The demo is a minimal, light-weight video chat app that transmits video via TokBox and text via Pusher. I've used other video-conferencing software before — often times at great expense to my company — but there's nothing that works as easily and seamlessly as this.

This is a prime example of the potential of the web, and it's great to be able to play with it today. Check it out for free at http://call.dialog.gs.

Posted on December 20, 2012
